This shows what the widget looks like. If there is currently no home screen widget, the size may not be correct because SecondsClock can\'t find out what size the widget would be: it will use an estimate for the size of a 1x1 widget. If you resize the widget on the home screen to a larger size, the widget will rearrange its layout to use a larger font size. The background pattern shows the effect of the widget background in case it is not transparent.

This page allows you to choose what to do next. Long press on any of the buttons for a longer description of what it does. This could have been a menu, but that would make you do an unnecessary extra click.

This page allows you to configure a widget. If you came here from a particular widget, it reconfigures that: if you came here from the top level page, it sets the configuration for new widgets. You can make multiple widgets with different configurations. Long press on anything for a longer description of what it does.
This page allows you to configure the full screen clock. Long press on anything for a longer description of what it does.
Show time in widget
If this box is checked, the widget will display the time in locale-appropriate format.
Show time with seconds in widget
If this box is checked, the widget will display the time in locale-appropriate format including seconds. This will increase battery drain since the widget has to update itself every second.
Show abbreviated day name in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate abbreviation for the day of the week.
Show full day name in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate full name for the day of the week.
Show numeric date in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate numeric date. If the numeric date is shown, the full date cannot be shown as well.
Show day of month in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the day of the month.
Show abbreviated month name in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate abbreviation for the month.
Show full month name in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the locale-appropriate full name for the month.
Show year in %1s.
If this box is checked, the %1s will display the (Gregorian) year.
Set widget background colour
Touch this button to show a colour chooser page for the background colour and opacity of the widget.
Set %1s text colour
Touch this button to show a colour chooser page for the text colour of the %1s.
This page provides sliders to set the hue, saturation, value, red, green, and blue values of the colour of the %1s\'s text. You can also type in values for any of these except the hue.

This page provides sliders to set the hue, saturation, value, red, green, blue, and opacity values of the colour of the widget\'s background. You can also type in values for any of these except the hue.
Set widget touch action
Touch this button to configure the action that will be performed when the widget is touched
This page provides buttons to select what action will be taken when the widget is touched. Long click on a button for a longer description of what it makes the widget do.
ACTION WHEN\nWIDGET TOUCHED
Hue

Move the thumb on this slider to set the hue of the %1s. This will not modify the value or saturation. Black, white and grayscale colours have a saturation of zero, so changing their hue will have no effect.
Saturation

Move the thumb on this slider to set the saturation of the %1s. This will not modify the hue or the value. Decreasing the saturation increases the amount of white in the colour: pale pink is unsaturated, while pure red is saturated.
Value

Move the thumb on this slider to set the value of the %1s. This will not modify the hue or the saturation. The value is approximately the brightness of the colour, but we use different names for some low-value colours: for example low-value red is brown.
Red
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of red in the colour of the %1s.
Green
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of green in the colour of the %1s.
Blue
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the amount of blue in the colour of the %1s.
Opacity
Move the thumb on this slider to adjust the opacity of the widget background: zero is transparent and 255 is fully opaque.

Touch this end of the slider for a clock with no seconds shown.
Touch in the middle of the slider for a clock with seconds shown at a smaller size.
Touch this end of the slider for a clock with seconds shown at the same size as the hours and minutes.
Simulate seven segment LED.
If you really want to waste your high resolution display simulating a seven segment LED clock, check this box.

Force vertical time layout

If this box is checked, in portrait orientation the hours minutes, seconds if present, and AM/PM marker if present, are arranged vertically down the screen. Otherwise if any of the numeric date or the full weekday or the full month name are displayed, the time is displayed across the screen.
Set full screen clock colour
Touch this button to show a colour chooser page for the colour of the full screen clock.
Define data displayed"
Touch this button to show a page on which you can define what data the full screen clock displays.
Control dimming
Touch this button to show a page on which you can control the size of the seconds display and the dimming at low light levels for the full screen clock.
Control dimming
Touch this button to show a page on which you can control the dimming at low light levels for the full screen clock.
This shows te current (unsmoothed) lux value, which is the light intensity seen by the front camera.
This shows the current screen brightness as computed by SecondsClock for the full screen clock.
This shows the current opacity as computed by SecondsClock for the full screen clock. This opacity is applied to the demo clock at the top left corner of the screen, but not to the controls.
Seconds size
Maximum brightness
This slider adjusts the maximum brightness of the full screen clock. See the README.md file for an explanation of how this works.
Minimum brightness
This slider adjusts the minimum brightness of the full screen clock. See the README.md file for an explanation of how this works.
Minimum opacity
This slider adjusts the minimum opacity of the full screen clock. See the README.md file for an explanation of how this works.
Lux threshold

This slider adjusts the ambient level in lux below which the full screen clock will reduce its brightness. The maximum is 9999 lux, which is a bright day, but not in direct sunlight. The scale is nonlinear in order to provide more resolution at lower values where users are more likely to want to start dimming.
Use only opacity for dimming
Check this box to use only the opacity for dimming. This saves power on OLED displays.
